page.title: 07SAND AND GRAVEL, WARE QUARRY
page.content: The site covers{72 acres}to the north of Ware Park.Extraction began in{1968 and will continue until{1993}when the present excavation area of{12 acres has been extended to Westmill Road. The quarry produces{2200 tonnes}of aggregate each day from 6a.m.to 6p.m. Sand, gravel and flint are extracted to a depth of{80 feet.}A caterpillar digs the top sandy layers and a crane digs the lower levels.They load their material onto a conveyor belt running to the{processing plant,}where it is washed and graded into sizes. Some of the{flint}is used in large pieces for hardcore but the rest is ground down into nut-sized pieces. These materials are essential for modern living. Sharp sand is used for bricks, soft sand for{concrete and {mortar}(made on the site) and gravel is needed for roads and buildings.
